    • Constructor Detail

      • BuildTargetParser

        public BuildTargetParser()

      • BuildTargetParser

        public BuildTargetParser(ImmutableMap<Optional<java.lang.String>,Optional<java.lang.String>> localToCanonicalRepoNamesMap)
        Parameters:
        localToCanonicalRepoNamesMap - Internally, buck uses a unique, global name to refer to each repository. All targets that live in repo X are represented internally using this unique name. However, other repos might have their own names for X, and rules inside of X will refer to each other with no explicit repo at all. This map provides the translation from local repo names used within the current repo to their unique, global repo names.

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        public BuildTarget parse(java.lang.String buildTargetName,
                BuildTargetPatternParser<?> buildTargetPatternParser)
        Parameters:
        buildTargetName - either a fully-qualified name or relative to the BuildTargetPatternParser. For example, inside first-party/orca/orcaapp/BUILD, which can be obtained by calling ParseContext.forBaseName("first-party/orca/orcaapp"), //first-party/orca/orcaapp:assets and :assets refer to the same target. However, from the command line the context is obtained by calling BuildTargetPatternParser.fullyQualified(BuildTargetParser) and relative names are not recognized.
        buildTargetPatternParser - how targets should be interpreted, such in the context of a specific build file or only as fully-qualified names (as is the case for targets from the command line).
